cont.entity_a: Improved distance and signal with SRX400 enhanced cards. Signal strength increased significantly compared to older models.

Setup.comm: Easy to set up and configure.

cont.entity_a: Setup is straightforward with various configuration options.
cont.entity_b: Easy to configure with a nice web interface. Easy to install with helpful dynamic DNS features.

cont.entity_a: Stopped working after a month, freezing up and unresponsive. Initially worked well but had problems after a year. Unreliable, dropping connections frequently. Not reliable for long-term use, frequent disconnections reported.
cont.entity_b: VPN connections drop regularly, requiring frequent reboots. Dual WAN option works sometimes, but not reliable with unstable ISPs. Experiences disconnections from remote servers. Slow and unstable performance.

cont.entity_a: Subnet address cannot be changed, restricting VPN remote access. Connection issues with VPN when saving changes.
cont.entity_b: VPN connections drop regularly, requiring frequent reboots. Suitable for smaller installations with less than 250 users. Reliable for small businesses with VPN and dual WAN capabilities. Great for site-to-site VPN, but lacks XAUTH user credentials.

cont.entity_a: Customer service was unhelpful and calls were dropped. Linksys tech support solved setup problems after a firmware update. Technical support varies in quality; some issues require expert help.
cont.entity_b: Poor customer support. Slow and unstable performance with poor tech support.

cont.entity_a: Firmware upgrade fixes connection drops. Firmware is buggy and lacks third-party support.
cont.entity_b: Still supports firmware upgrades with VPN and firewall options.

Cannot redirect ports, which is a limitation. Load balancing does not work with secure connections. Router overburdens with bandwidth management. Not suitable for VoIP systems due to port issues. Issues with some VoIP providers.
